Description: Rectangular textile fragment; undyed linen cloth of medium quality; double self-band separated by 3 plain picks; one end very worn towards one end. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.22 ends per 10mm (splicing is hard to spot) and weft c.10-11 picks per 10mm. Edges are torn or ragged, and there may originally have been a fringe beyone the worn end.
Curator's comments: The late-ish date is suggested by the lack of clarity of splicing. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor [1992]
